SENT.plain: PURPOSE: To report an uncommon case of superior ophthalmic vein occlusion secondary to antiphospholipid syndrome
RESULT: A 41 year old man who presented with acute proptosis and ophthalmoplegia who was initially treated for orbital cellulitis
His CT scan showed changes consistent of that a superior ophthalmic vein thrombosis
He was managed with high dose intravenous steroid and commenced on anticoagulant therapy
He was subsequently diagnosed with antiphospholipid syndrome
CONCLUSION: Although superior ophthalmic vein occlusion is rare it is an important differential
This is the first reported case secondary to antiphospholipid syndrome
